4.1.1.1.12. src.IOT_Operation module¶

-- coding: utf-8 --

File: IOT_Operation.py

Class IOT_Operation

A general class for operations.

IOT stands for INAOE OCT Tools

Log:
Date Author Description
4-Aug-2018 FOE
  • Isolated minimal solution.
  • Encapsulated in class.
22-Aug-2018 FOE
  • Rebranded to capital “O” in operation; IOT_Operation
  • Updated known subclasses
  • Defined method getClassName
  • _arity attribute “downgraded” from class to instance attribute
  • _arity get/set methods added
23-Sep-2018 FOE
  • Updated comments and added Sphinx documentation to the class.
  • _arity attribute “upgraded” from attribute to property arity and property getter/setter added
  • _arity get/set methods deprecated.
26-Sep-2018 FOE
  • The class becomes abstract and a new abstract method execute is provided.
  • Added support to hold operands.
  • Arity now becomes only the number of the operands. get/setArity methods are now deprecated
1-Dec-2018 FOE
  • Signature of execute() method now accepts parameters and return result instead of None.
20-Jan-2018 FOE
  • Added method setOperand.

See also

None

class src.IOT_Operation.IOT_Operation(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: abc.ABC

An abstract base class for operations on IOT_OCTvolume and IOT_OCTscan .

An abstract base class for operations on IOT_OCTvolume and IOT_OCTscan.

Example:tmp = IOT_OCTscan(img) o = IOT_OperationFlattening() o.addOperand(tmp) o.arity() #return 1 o.execute() #Flattens the image
Known subclasses:
 
  • IOT_OperationEditSegmentation
  • IOT_OperationFlattening
  • IOT_OperationMeasureLayerThickness
  • IOT_OperationPerfilometer
  • IOT_OperationSegmentation
  • IOT_OperationStitch

See also

None

Note

None

Todo

  • Support to hold operand names.
addOperand(op, i=None)[source]¶

Add a new operand.

Parameters:
  • op (int) – The operand.
  • i – (optional) The operand order. If given it may shift the order of other operands already set. If not given, the operand is appended at the end of the list of operands.
Returns:

None
arity()[source]¶

Gets the operation arity (number of operands).

Returns:The operation arity
Return type:int
clear()[source]¶

Clears the operands; Removes all operands.

Returns:None
execute(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Executes the operation on the operands.

This is an abstract method. Executes the operation on the .operands and stores the outcome in .result

Operation meta-parameters may be also passed.

Returns:Result of executing the operation.
Return type:Type of result -depends on subclass implementation-.
getClassName()[source]¶

Get the class name as a string.

Get the class name as a string.

Returns:The class name.
Return type:string
name¶

The operation name

Getter:Gets the operation name
Setter:Sets the operation name.
Type:string
operands¶

The list of operands.

Getter:Gets the list of operands
Setter:Sets the list of operands.
Type:list
result¶

The list of results.

This is a read only property. There is no setter method.

Getter:Gets the list of results
Setter:Sets the list of results
Type:list
setOperand(op, i)[source]¶

Set an operand; substitutes an existing operand with a new one.

Calling setOperand when the i-th operand has not been previously set will result in an out-of-range error.

Parameters:
  • op (int) – The new operand.
  • i – The operand order. Operand index is zero-base i.e. the first operand occupies i=0
Returns:

None
